questions.text: Which of the following is considered personal information?

options.text: ID or passport number
options.feedback: ✅ Correct! ID numbers are highly sensitive personal information.

options.text: Favorite color
options.feedback: ❌ Favorite colors are not considered sensitive.

options.text: Game nickname
options.feedback: ❌ Game nicknames are not usually personal identifiers.

questions.text: If you receive an email asking you to click a link to log into your bank account, you should:

options.text: Click the link immediately
options.feedback: ❌ This could be a phishing email.

options.text: Ignore the email completely
options.feedback: ⚠️ Safer than clicking, but best to verify via official channels.

options.text: Visit the official bank website or call customer service
options.feedback: ✅ Correct! Always verify through official sources.

questions.text: What is the correct way to create a strong password?

options.text: Use your birthday or phone number
options.feedback: ❌ Easy for attackers to guess.

options.text: Use at least 12 characters with uppercase, lowercase, numbers, and symbols
options.feedback: ✅ Correct! This meets strong password standards.

options.text: Use the same password for all accounts
options.feedback: ❌ If one is stolen, all accounts are at risk.

questions.text: The main purpose of Multi-Factor Authentication (MFA) is to:

options.text: Avoid remembering passwords
options.feedback: ❌ MFA is not a replacement for passwords.

options.text: Add an extra step of identity verification for more security
options.feedback: ✅ Correct! MFA adds a second layer of defense.

options.text: Allow automatic login
options.feedback: ❌ MFA does not make accounts log in automatically.

questions.text: Which action can reduce the risk of phishing attacks?

options.text: Clicking unknown short links
options.feedback: ❌ Short links can hide malicious URLs.

options.text: Hovering over links to see the real URL
options.feedback: ✅ Correct! This helps detect fake websites.

options.text: Entering your credentials in email links
options.feedback: ❌ This is risky and could lead to account theft.

questions.text: To protect your privacy on social media, you should:

options.text: Limit privacy settings so strangers can’t see your info
options.feedback: ✅ Correct! This reduces exposure to threats.

options.text: Share as many life details as possible to gain popularity
options.feedback: ❌ Oversharing increases privacy risks.

options.text: Post pet names, birthdays, or family names
options.feedback: ❌ These could be used as password clues.

questions.text: If you get an SMS saying your package delivery failed and includes a link, you should:

options.text: Click the link to update your info
options.feedback: ❌ This could be SMS phishing.

options.text: Call the delivery company’s official customer service
options.feedback: ✅ Correct! Always verify via official contact.

options.text: Reply with your verification code
options.feedback: ❌ Never give out verification codes.

questions.text: What is the main purpose of a password manager?

options.text: Help you store and generate secure passwords
options.feedback: ✅ Correct! Password managers keep your passwords safe.

options.text: Automatically fill in all verification codes
options.feedback: ❌ Verification codes usually require manual input or MFA.

options.text: Let you use one password for everything
options.feedback: ❌ This would increase the risk of account breaches.

questions.text: Which is an example of a hardware MFA device?

options.text: YubiKey
options.feedback: ✅ Correct! YubiKey is a physical security key.

options.text: SMS verification code
options.feedback: ❌ This is a software-based method.

options.text: Password manager
options.feedback: ❌ A password manager is not MFA.

questions.text: Which action can help prevent SIM card swapping attacks?

options.text: Use an authenticator app instead of SMS codes
options.feedback: ✅ Correct! Authenticator apps are more secure.

options.text: Change your phone number often
options.feedback: ❌ This does not necessarily prevent SIM swapping.

options.text: Send verification codes to friends
options.feedback: ❌ This would expose your security codes.
